Despite destruction and death, Israelis widely support war against Iran
description: The overwhelming majority of the population supports Israel's strikes against Iran, partly because of the nuclear threat but also the hope for regional peace if the regime in Tehran collapses.

Russia and Ukraine swap more prisoners after Istanbul talks
description: Russia and Ukraine exchanged captured soldiers on Friday in the latest prisoner swap agreed during peace talks in Istanbul, offering a rare sign of cooperation despite stalled negotiations and continued fighting.

headline: The French government is stepping in to rescue Eutelsat
description: By subscribing to more than half of the €1.35 billion capital increase of the French satellite internet specialist Eutelsat, the French government will hold 29% of the group's capital, becoming its largest shareholder. Eutelsat is currently the only alternative to Elon Musk's American Starlink satellite constellation.

headline: Beyoncé brings Texas flair to Stade de France
description: The American superstar performed the first of three concerts at the arena in Saint-Denis on Thursday. The show centered on tracks from her latest album, Cowboy Carter.

headline: Paris extends summer bar and restaurant terrace hours, angering noise-weary neighbors
description: The measure, which starts on June 21 and lasts until September 14, also faces criticism from right-wing and centrist opposition members on the city council of the French capital.

How Trump broke with his strategic allies to side with Russia over Ukraine
description: 'The Transatlantic Divorce' (5/5). After Barack Obama stepped back during the 2014 annexation of Crimea and Joe Biden hesitated, Donald Trump, now back in the White House, aligned himself with Russia at the UN and left his strategic allies alone to face Vladimir Putin.

headline: How close is Iran to having nuclear weapons?
description: Israel has bombed strategic sites in Iran, which it said could soon produce a nuclear weapon. Tehran had announced it was increasing its production of enriched uranium, amid stalled talks with the United States.
byline: Manon Romain,  Pierre Breteau and  Zoé Multeau

headline: Limiting global warming to 1.5°C is now impossible
description: According to a group of scientists, the target set by the 2015 Paris Agreement can no longer be met due to the inability of countries to reduce greenhouse gas emissions.
